1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: The restaurant critic and bon viveur hosts a search for home-cooked meals presented to professional standards. The contest begins with two dinner parties in north-west England, in which competitors set out to win one of Michael's Dining Star awards and a chance to cook for his celebrity gathering at the end of the series. Justine Forest, of Longridge, Lancashire, prepares beef Wellington, and Dean Lewis, from Wilmslow, Cheshire, cooks a West Indian starter of ginger and coconut prawns followed by curried goat.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: The restaurant critic continues the search for the UK's best home cooks as the hosts of two more dinner parties compete to win one of his Dining Star awards. Peter Polledri serves mushroom risotto followed by herb-crusted lamb in Loughton, Essex, while cheese souffle, partridge and crepes are on the menu at Charmian Dickson's home in Blairgowrie, Perth and Kinross.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot:

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: The two finalists chosen as Michael's favourite home cooks of the series go head to head in Cornwall, preparing a three-course dinner to be judged by local villagers. At stake is a chance for the winner to cook for the restaurant critic's celebrity guests - including Roger Moore, Kym Marsh, Andrew Neil, Giorgio Locatelli and Christine Bleakley - at a dinner party in his London mansion.

imdb.title: Michael Winner's Dining Stars
plot: Contestants invite film director and food critic Michael Winner into their home and cook for him, the winner is given the honourary title of Michael Winner's Dining Star.
